thread.title: Sex offender back in jail after school dance photo surfaces
thread.title_full: Sex offender back in jail after school dance photo surfaces

author: Raisa Habersham
title: Sex offender back in jail after school dance photo surfaces
text:
A photo of a convicted child molester at an elementary school dance landed him back behind bars, according to Channel 2 Action News.
How this image landed a convicted child molester back behind bars tonight @ 11 pic.twitter.com/4KA1sshw1W
— Carl Willis (@CarlWillisWSB) February 24, 2017 Charlie Bell told the television station something seemed off about his ex-girlfriend’s new beau.
“So, I took his name and looked him up on the internet,” Bell said.
He found William McDougal listed on the GBI’s Sex Offender Registry.
Illegal contact? Registered sex offender accused of violating probation by attending school's Valentine's Day dance. More @ 11 pic.twitter.com/Agn7MhfgxB
— Carl Willis (@CarlWillisWSB) February 24, 2017 McDougal, 37, had been convicted of child molestation in Clayton County in 2014. He was sentenced to 10 years in prison, but served two years and was released on parole.
Convicted child molester and registered sex offender got off of parole Friday. He's back in jail less than a week later. I'll explain @11 pic.twitter.com/dxQjoyJjM1
— Carl Willis (@CarlWillisWSB) February 24, 2017 As part of his probation, McDougal wasn’t supposed to have any contact with children.
Bell said McDougal had been to his daughter’s school multiple times, most recently at a Valentine’s Day dance.
He told Channel 2 he contacted authorities Feb. 17 about McDougal, who was arrested Thursday at a meeting with his probation officer.
McDougal will be taken to Clayton County for a probation violation hearing.
William McDougal, 37, was convicted and sentenced to 10 years in prison for child molestation. He served three years and was out on parole.
